plugins.name: DevPlugin - Copy Disign
plugins.description:
DevPlugin is a plugin for fast migration of components.


DevPlugin automates the process of obtaining and implementing components into web projects. The plugin creates secure scripts based on the layout and allows you to use them on any external resources.


What he can do:

  1. Generating a custom JS script
  2. Personal account with subscription management and action history
  3. Data encryption and protection of user tokens


Fits:

  1. UI/UX designer
  2. Developers of landing pages and interfaces
  3. To the authors of design systems
plugins.tagline: We will help you transfer your design to the constructor with all the adaptive designs.

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
üòü FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


ü•≥ PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


‚å®Ô∏è KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: BrandLife
plugins.description: Seamlessly integrate your design workflow with BrandLife using the BrandLife Figma Plugin. Effortlessly import files from your BrandLife library directly into Figma and use them in your creative projects. Once your designs are ready, export assets back into BrandLife, ensuring they are correctly organized within the right assets and collections. Simplify collaboration, maintain brand consistency, and keep your assets organized‚Äîall from within Figma.
plugins.tagline: Sync files between BrandLife and Figma

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

134292.name: comodo exporter
134292.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
134292.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

plugins.name: RocketPen - Generate UI with AI and edit freely
plugins.description:
RocketPen is a tool that leverages artificial intelligence (AI) to help users create UI designs.

RocketPen aims to significantly boost your productivity.


Value

üìåOpen Editing Permissions: AI-generated designs can be flexibly edited and modified

üöÄBoost Design Efficiency: Smart generation replaces manual drawing

üé®Maintain Design Consistency: Automatically adapts to brand design specifications

üí¨Natural Language Interaction: Generate professional designs with simple descriptions

üì±Multi-platform Design Support: Unified design for Web/Mobile/Desktop platforms

üì¶Design Asset Reuse: By using the Chrome extension together, you can convert any websites into editable Figma designs.


Features

Text-to-Design Generation

Generate UI design drafts based on DesignTokens through text descriptions


Website-to-Design File Conversion

Convert any website into editable Figma design files, requires use with the Chrome extension RocketPenSelector


DesignToken

Support variables definition for DesignToken with visual DesignToken output


Quick Chart Generation

Support common chart types including bar charts, line charts, pie charts, radar charts, etc.


Precise Content Generation

Generate corresponding content through text descriptions within specified Frames


Precise Resource Import

Import icons, images and other resources through text descriptions:

Generate four high-definition animal images


Generate a navigation bar with four buttons: Chat, Contacts, Discover, Settings



Notes

üîí Privacy Protection: We do not store any user data. Only DesignTokens (variables) are uploaded, and all generated design files remain stored locally on your device. Your data security is fully protected.


üöß Development Status: This plugin is currently in active development. We're continuously refining the model and workflows to deliver higher-quality design outputs and an improved user experience.



Thank you for your support and understanding! If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Your Vision,AI-Powered.Generate UI designs instantly with AI, then edit freely to match your vision

plugins.name: Jo - Instant Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Stop designing in the dark.

Jo gives you instant validation without leaving Figma.


Two ways to get unstuck:

üîç Heuristic Check ‚Äî Usability feedback against Nielsen's 10 principles

Select a frame ‚Üí get ranked issues with specific fixes


üìä Quick Poll ‚Äî Stakeholder sign-off in minutes

Select 2-4 frames ‚Üí Generate link ‚Üí teammates vote/comment (no Figma login required)


Why designers are loving Jo:

‚úÖ In-Context Feedback: Feedback panel sits right next to your canvas.

üéØ Actionable Insights: Specific fixes, not vague opinions.

‚è±Ô∏è Zero Meeting Overhead: Async feedback that actually works.

üîÅ Iteration-Friendly: Tweak, test, and ship with confidence.


Perfect for:

Validating concepts, streamlining stakeholder buy-in, catching usability issues before dev handoff.


Ready to design with confidence?

Install Jo today and transform your feedback loops!
plugins.tagline: Get AI and teammate feedback on your designs. No meetings, no guesswork.

plugins.name: Token Extractor & Kotlin Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you seamlessly export your design system tokens from Figma to Android development with Kotlin.


üéØ Key Features

‚Ä¢ Scan selected components or frames for design tokens

‚Ä¢ Supports primitives, spacing, and typography

‚Ä¢ Converts tokens into Android-compatible Kotlin objects (Colors.kt, Dimens.kt, Typography.kt)

‚Ä¢ Outputs clean, structured Kotlin code using dp, sp, and Color(...)

‚Ä¢ Friendly UI with JSON preview and file export options


Perfect for Android teams using Jetpack Compose and looking to keep design & code in sync.
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Android-ready Kotlin files.

plugins.name: Fastr Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Fastr compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Fastr Frontend platform. One quick import is all it takes to transform your Figma files into fully interactive experiences‚Äîbrand components, fonts, and layouts intact. Get ready to edit, animate, and publish designs faster than ever before.


How to use the plug-in

If you have any issues when using the plugin, we recommend visiting our community article, which has a full guide and FAQs. For more information about the Fastr Frontend platform, please visit our website.


Reporting Issues

For any questions, please email support@getfastr.com and our team can assist further


License


This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

Copyright (c) KALEIDOS INC

The Fastr Exporter was built using the Penpot Exporter.

Penpot and the Penpot exporter plugin are Kaleidos‚Äô open source projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Bring Your Figma Designs into Fastr Frontend

plugins.name: Design to System
plugins.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system ‚Äî effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. üîç Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. üìå Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. üéØ Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements ‚Äî ensuring consistency and systemization.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system ‚Äì automatically.

136167.name: Design to System
136167.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system ‚Äî effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. üîç Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. üìå Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. üéØ Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements ‚Äî ensuring consistency and systemization.
136167.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system ‚Äì automatically.

plugins.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
plugins.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template
plugins.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

137250.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
137250.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template

137250.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., ‚ÄúUS zip code‚Äù, ‚Äúcompany name‚Äù, ‚Äúcity in Japan‚Äù).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

140216.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
140216.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., ‚ÄúUS zip code‚Äù, ‚Äúcompany name‚Äù, ‚Äúcity in Japan‚Äù).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with OpenAI's API to generate AI-powered text content for selected layers in Figma.

140216.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider ü§î


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets ‚Üí Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.

Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider ü§î


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data

```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets ‚Üí Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Token Architect
plugins.description:
Token Architect is a comprehensive design token management solution that bridges the gap between Figma and your development workflow. Create, export, and import design tokens with intelligent automation and bidirectional sync capabilities.


KEY FEATURES:

  1. Generate Complete Token Systems - Create comprehensive design tokens from a single brand colour with automatic shade generation
  2. Smart Color Palette Generation - Transform any colour into professional 100-900 shade scales with HSL-based algorithms
  3. Export Figma Variables - Convert your Figma variables into industry-standard JSON tokens
  4. Import External Tokens - Bring design tokens from popular tools (Style Dictionary, Design Tokens W3C) into Figma
  5. Advanced Token Classification - Automatic organisation into primitives and semantic token hierarchies
  6. Multi-Category Support - Colours, spacing, typography, responsive breakpoints, and semantic tokens
  7. Real-time Preview & Validation - Live JSON output with comprehensive debugging capabilities


PERFECT FOR:

  1. Design system managers building tokens from scratch or maintaining consistency
  2. Frontend developers implementing design tokens in modern frameworks
  3. Teams using tools like Style Dictionary, Tokens Studio, or custom token pipelines
  4. Organisations scaling design systems across products and platforms



Please reach out to ozarg.studio@gmail.com if you have any issues or would like to request a feature. Or let's connect on LinkedIn. Cool ideas welcome :)

accepted.name: OZAR STUDIO
accepted.description: We are a design studio working worldwide . We provide a range of design and development services.

plugins.tagline: Export and Import your variables in a developer-friendy way

plugins.name: Fast Page Selector

Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace

plugins.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados
plugins.description:
How does this plugin work?


Users can automate the creation of personalized certificates inside Figma, avoiding the manual copy-pasting of required data.



Step-by-step: How to use the plugin


1 - Create the base design in Figma

  1. Design a certificate inside a Frame or Component.
  2. Use text layers named like #NAME, #COURSE, #DATE, etc.
  3. These names will be automatically replaced with data from the Sheet.


2 ‚Äì Prepare the Google Sheet

  1. Create a public Google Sheet.
  2. In the first row, write the field names: NAME, COURSE, DATE, ID, etc.
  3. Fill the rows with each person‚Äôs data.
  4. Make sure the document is public (set to ‚ÄúAnyone with the link can view‚Äù).


3 ‚Äì Select your design in Figma

  1. Select the Frame or Component containing your base design.
  2. Only one selection is allowed when running the plugin.


4 ‚Äì Open the plugin

  1. Run the plugin from the Figma menu.
  2. Paste the Google Sheet link.
  3. Enter the sheet name (e.g., Students).
  4. Toggle the ‚ÄúShow ID‚Äù option on or off if you want to hide it.


5 ‚Äì Preview (optional)

  1. Click ‚ÄúPreview‚Äù to generate just one sample certificate.


6 ‚Äì Generate certificates

  1. Click ‚ÄúGenerate.‚Äù
  2. The plugin will clone your base design, replace the fields, and automatically arrange the certificates on the Figma page.


7 - Have fun!
plugins.tagline: Dise√±√° uno, gener√° cientos. Certificados personalizados en Figma desde un Google Sheet.

139581.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados

2 ‚Äì Prepare the Google Sheet

  4. Make sure the document is public (set to ‚ÄúAnyone with the link can view‚Äù).


3 ‚Äì Select your design in Figma

  2. Only one selection is allowed when running the plugin.


4 ‚Äì Open the plugin

plugins.name: Motionmill
plugins.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles‚Äîboth as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes‚Äîall clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.
plugins.tagline: Colors and Typography for Motionmill

132803.name: Motionmill
132803.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles‚Äîboth as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes‚Äîall clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.

132027.tagline: Transform any app or game into a UI Flow

plugins.name: View Jumper
plugins.description: View Jumper helps designers quickly navigate large Figma files by creating visual bookmarks. Users set two key locations (View A and View B) that they need to reference frequently, then instantly teleport between them with preserved zoom levels and page context. Whether using the UI buttons, menu commands, or keyboard shortcuts, this plugin eliminates the frustration of constantly scrolling and searching through complex designs, making workflow significantly more efficient when comparing or referencing different areas.

accepted.name: Christopher
accepted.description:
Product Design @ heyo.is
Brand Design @ MARKoftheBRAND.com

plugins.tagline: Set viewpoints A & B. Teleport between design locations with a click.

plugins.name: LocalizeBuddy
plugins.description:
üåè Introducing LocalizeBuddy for Figma ‚Äî Your Ultimate i18n Export Companion!


LocalizeBuddy automatically extracts every text layer from your Figma file and converts it into clean, structured JSON‚Äîperfectly formatted for any localization pipeline. Skip the tedious copy-and-paste: design and ship faster with truly seamless internationalization. ‚ú®


Standout Features:


üîç Comprehensive Text Discovery

Auto-detects every text node, even deep inside groups, components, and nested frames.


üîë Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchy‚Äîe.g. page1.frame2.text3‚Äîso every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


üìÇ Structured JSON Output

Preserve your art-board and frame hierarchy in the output to keep context clear for translators.


üñºÔ∏è Frame-Only Export

Export the selected frame in one click‚Äîideal for precise, frame-level JSON extraction.

accepted.name: Alvin Bellero
accepted.description: Crafting code and building dreams, one line at a time üë®üèª‚Äçüíªü§ûüöÄ

plugins.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click‚Äîinstantly accelerate i18n setup!

plugins.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
plugins.description:
GRAD gives you unprecedented control over colour transitions through the power of Bezier curves. This sophisticated plugin brings laboratory-grade precision to your gradient work through highly-customisable curves. Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface
  5. Generate exact colour stops based on mathematical interpolation
  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
plugins.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

132857.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
132857.description:

plugins.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator
plugins.description:
A plugin that helps you easily explore and manage complex Figma pages by generating a Table of Contents (TOC).


Features

1. In-plugin TOC generation

  1. Automatically collects frames with a specified prefix to generate a TOC
  2. Currently sorts frames based on their X-axis position on the Figma canvas (support for layer order coming soon)
  3. Click items to instantly navigate to the corresponding frame
  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  1. Create a TOC frame directly on the Figma canvas
  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
plugins.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix.‚Ä®Click items to quickly navigate.

128139.name: TOC Please - Auto TOC Generator

  4. Supports up to 2 levels of nested items


2. Canvas TOC generation

  2. The TOC frame is fully customizable to suit your needs.
  3. When TOC content changes, simply select the TOC frame and click ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù to refresh the content while preserving your custom styles.
128139.release_notes: Optimized speed of extracting frames for TOC
128139.tagline: Auto-generate a TOC from frames with a specific prefix.‚Ä®Click items to quickly navigate.

plugins.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
plugins.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like ‚ÄúRectangle 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúText 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúFrame,‚Äù or ‚ÄúGroup.‚Äù It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

‚Ä¢Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

‚Ä¢Large text (‚â• 18px or ‚â• 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.
plugins.tagline: Automate. Validate. Elevate.

127028.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
127028.description:

In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like ‚ÄúRectangle 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúText 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúFrame,‚Äù or ‚ÄúGroup.‚Äù It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

‚Ä¢Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

‚Ä¢Large text (‚â• 18px or ‚â• 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access external resources for WCAG contrast checking and design pattern validation.
